intro: Lestibudesia virgata, commonly known as the Virgin's Bane, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking violet-blue flowers that bloom in the summer months. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are woody and often branched. Due to its rarity and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
